column1: An international traveller qualifies as an international visitor with respect to the country
of reference if: (a) he/she is on a tourism trip and (b) he/she is a non-resident travelling
in the country of reference or a resident travelling outside of it (IRTS 2008, 2.42).
The  term  “International  Excursionist”  (same  day  visitor)  refers  to  an  “International
Visitor”01, who does not stay overnight in the country visited.
